dialogues.text: Sammy Jankis. Yeah, I guess I tell people about Sammy to help them understand. Sammy's story helps me understand my own situation. Leonard touches the tattoo on the back of his hand. LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammy Jankis wrote himself endless notes. But he'd get mixed up. I've got a more graceful solution to the memory problem. I'm disciplined and organized. I use habit and routine to make my life possible. Sammy had no drive. No reason to make it work. Leonard can see his reflection in the mirror. He studies tattoo across his chest: "JOHN G. RAPED AND MURDERED MY WIFE". LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? I gotta reason. MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.text: 23   EXT. THE CITY GRILL ON MAIN ST. - DAY <<colour se </colour> Leonard parks the Jaguar, gets out, stops outside the doo a restaurant, checking its name against a NOTE, written o SMALL PAPER BAG FROM A PHARMACY. The note says:

Leonard spins around. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't remember me. LEONARD (friendly smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I should have explained. You see, I have this condition - NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did explain, Lenny. Leonard shifts uncomfortably. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please call me Leonard. My wife called me Lenny. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me. Leonard raises his eyebrows, then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I probably told you how much I hated it. Could you take off your sunglasses? It's just hard for me - Natalie takes them off to reveal her bruises. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you have information for me? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what your little note says? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be tough living life according to a few scraps of paper. Mix up your laundry list and your grocery list, you'll be eating your underwear. Natalie smiles. NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I guess that's why you got those freaky tattoos. Leonard is surprised. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is tough. Almost impossible. I'm sorry I can't remember you. It's not personal. Natalie's smile fades. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. She takes a BROWN ENVELOPE out of her handbag. NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do have information for you. You gave me a license plate number? I had my friend at the DMV trace it. Guess what name came up. Leonard shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Edward Gamme11. John G.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know him? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But the photo on his license looked familiar. I think he's been in the bar before Natalie slides the envelope towards him, but stops short. NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a copy of his registration, license, photo and all. Are you sure you want this? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I told you what this man did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you shouldn't have to ask. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But even if you get your revenge, you won't remember it. You won't even know it's happened. LEONARD (annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'll take a picture, get a tattoo. (calms)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world doesn't disappear when you close your eyes, does it? My actions still have meaning, even if I can't remember them. My wife deserves vengeance, and it doesn't make any difference whether I know about it. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about her again. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you like to remember her. I want to see you enjoy yourself. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was beautiful. Perfect to me -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't just recite the words. Close your eyes, remember her. Leonard smiles and shuts his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 25   INT. LEONARD'S APARTMENT - DAY <<colour sequence= </colour> Random images of a woman (30's, black hair, plain). Jump of details: a smile, eating, tucking her hair behind her pulling on a pair of trousers, watching TV, shouting in anger. Sitting on the edge of the bed in her underwear, s TURNS as Leonard pinches her thigh. LEONARD (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can only feel details. Bits and pieces which you didn't bother to put into words. And extreme moments you feel even if you don't want to. Put it together and you get the feel of the person, enough to know how much you miss them, and how much you hate the person who took them away. 26   INT. CITY GRILL - DAY - <<colour sequence="">> </colour> Leonard opens his eyes. Natalie is looking at him. She no and hands him the BROWN ENVELOPE. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wrote an address in there, too. Might be useful. It's this abandoned place outside of town. I guy I know used to use it for his bigger deals. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deals? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's isolated. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds perfect? What do I owe you? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't helping you for money. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your fault. See, you have this condition... Leonard smiles. Natalie reaches into her purse and pulls a MOTEL ROOM KEY. NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you still at the Discount Inn? Room 304? You left this at my place. Leonard pulls out a Polaroid of the Discount Inn. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Discount Inn, yeah. Natalie leaves the key and gets up from the table. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They treating you alright? LEONARD (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't remember. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what we have in common? Leonard shrugs. NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're both survivors. Take care, Leonard. Leonard watches Natalie leave. He sits at the table, look down at the BROWN ENVELOPE and the MOTEL ROOM KEY (ROOM 3 Leonard rises, and heads to the restroom. 27   INT. RESTAURANT RESTROOM - DAY <<colour sequence= </colour> Leonard flushes the urinal, then moves to the sink and st washing his hands. He notices a MESSAGE written on the ba of his hand:

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He stares at the message for a second, thoughtful, then t to scrub the writing off his skin. To his surprise, it is INDELIBLE. Leonard looks at it, quizzical, then notices s markings on his wrists, pulling his sleeve back to get a better look. He can read the start of a message:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Blue Revisions - 8/27/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Leonard is about to roll his sleeve up further when the restroom door opens and a MAN enters. Leonard dries his hands, then exits the rest room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard (IN BOXERS, BANDAGED ARM) talks on the phone. He resumes SHAVING his thigh. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met Sammy through work. (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insurance. I was an investigator. I'd investigate claims to see which ones were phony. Leonard dips the razor into the steaming ice bucket. LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to see through people's bullshit. It was useful experience, because now it's my life. When I meet someone, I don't even know if I've met them before. I have to look in their eyes and just figure them out. My job taught me that the best way to find out what someone knew was to let them talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montage: Leonard, wearing a CHEAP DARK SUIT and TIE, sitt opposite various DIFFERENT PEOPLE in an interview situati LEONARD(V.0.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw in the occasional "why?" but just listen. And watch the eyes, the body language. Leonard watches the people's movements carefully. We see close-ups off fiddling hands, neck scratching, etc. LEONARD (V.0.) (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's complicated. You might catch a sign but attach the wrong meaning to it. If someone touches their nose while they're talking, experts will tell you it means they're lying. It really means they're nervous, and people get nervous for all sorts of reasons. It's all about context. MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was good. Sammy was my first real challenge. 31   EXT. DISCOUNT INN - DAY <<colour sequence="">> </colour> The Jaguar pulls up. Leonard gets out and heads to the office. 32   INT. DISCOUNT INN OFFICE - DAY <<colour sequence= </colour> Burt is behind the counter reading a magazine. LEONARD

dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I think I'm checked in here, But I've misplaced my key. BURT (looks up)

On the bedside table is an ICE BUCKET. Next to it is a DISPOSABLE RAZOR and a can of SHA FOAM. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see my key. Burt looks up. He REALIZES something. BURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Wrong room. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Burt tries to SHEPHERD Leonard out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Blue Revisions - 8/27/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't your room. You're in 304. I Fucked up. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't my room? BURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, let's go. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why is this my handwriting? Leonard picks a WHITE PAPER BAG up off the floor. Handwri on the side is a message:

dialogues.speaker: "SHAVE THIGH"
dialogues.text: LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better tell me what the fuck's going on. Burt looks uncomfortable. BURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was your room. You're up in 304 now. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was I in here? BURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last week. Then I rented you another one On top of this. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? BURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Business is slow. I told my boss about You, about your condition. He told me to Try and rent you another room. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you clean it out? BURT (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're still paying for it. It's still Your room. Leonard shakes his head, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Blue Revisions - 8/27/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how many rooms am I checked into in this dump? BURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just two. So far. Leonard walks out past Burt. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, at least you're being honest about cheating me. BURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well you're not gonna remember, anyway. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to be that honest, Burt. BURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard. Leonard turns. Burt grins. BURT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always get a receipt. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna write that down. Leonard fishes a piece of paper out of his pocket. There message on it which he reads. It says:

dialogues.speaker: INFO"
dialogues.text: Leonard looks up at Burt. LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it? 35   EXT. ROAD - DAY <<colour sequence="">> </colour> The Jaguar speeds along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 36   EXT. THE CITY GRILL ON MAIN STREET - DAY <<colour </colour> Leonard checks the restaurant name against the note. He g out his Polaroids, FLIPPING through them until he finds t one of Natalie. MEMENTO Blue Revisions - 8/27/99

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 37   INT. THE CITY GRILL ON MAIN STREET - DAY <<colour </colour> Leonard walks through the restaurant, checking the patron He makes eye contact with Natalie, but walks past her tab She sighs and grabs the back of his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard (in boxers, bandaged arm) SHAVES his thigh, talki on the phone. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd just become an investigator when I came across Sammy. Mr Samuel R. Jankis - strangest case ever. Guy's 58, semi- retired accountant. He and his wife had been in this car accident... nothing too serious, but he's acting funny - he can't get a handle on what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOCTOR examines SAMMY'S head. SAMMY'S WIFE looks on. LEONARD(V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctors find some possible damaqe to the hippocampus, nothing conclusive. But Sammy can't remember anything for more than a couple minutes. He can't work, can't do shit, medical bills pile up, his wife calls the insurance company and I get sent in.

dialogues.speaker: AND WHITE SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: SAMMY sits smoking, smiling at Leonard (CHEAP SUIT and TI LEONARD (V.0.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My first big claims investigation - I really check into it. Sammy can think just fine, but he can't make any new memories, he can only remember things for a few minutes. Sammy watches a commercial on T.V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEONARD (V.0.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd watch T.V., but anything longer than a couple of minutes was too confusing, he couldn't remember how it began. He liked commercials. They were short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammy rolls a small GLASS BOTTLE between the palms of his hands. Mrs. Jankis rolls up her sleeve. Leonard watches a Sammy takes a SYRINGE and pushes the needle through the rubber of the bottle. The label is marked "INSULIN". LEONARD (V.O.)(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crazy part was that this guy who couldn't follow the plot of "Green Acres" could do the most complicated things as long as he had learned them before the accident... Sammy INVERTS the bottle and syringe, DRAWS the insulin i the syringe, withdraws the needle, holds it up to check f bubbles, TAPPING it delicately. LEONARD (V.0.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and as long as he kept his mind on what he was doing. Sammy wipes a spot on Mrs. Jankis' arm with a swab, then gently PINCHES the skin and confidently INSERTS the needl Mrs Jankis winces. MRS JANKIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentle. Sammy looks up, worried. Mrs Jankis smiles at him. Sammy the plunger, withdraws the needle and presses the swab ag the skin, lookinq into Mrs Jankis' eyes and smiling back.

dialogues.speaker: SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: Mrs. Jankis opens the front door to Leonard. Leonard shak hands with Sammy, who smiles at him in apparent recogniti LEONARD (V.0.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctors assure me that there's a real condition called Korsokoff's syndrome; short-term memory loss, rare but legit. But every time I see him I catch a look of recognition. Just a slight look, but he says he can't remember me at all. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can read people and I'm thinking bad actor. Now I'm suspicious and I order more tests.

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO LEONARD IN MOTEL ROOM
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard DABS at some blood on his thigh with toilet paper LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His wife has to do everything. Sammy can only do simple stuff. He couldn't pick up any new skills at all, and that's how I got him. 43   EXT. MAIN STREET - DAY <<colour sequence="">> </colour> Leonard's Jaguar pulls up at a red light. Suddenly Teddy BANGING on the window. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny! I thought you'd gone for good. What brings you back? Leonard looks at Teddy, sizing him up. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfinished business. What made you think I wasn't coming back? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you were leaving town. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things change. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I see. It's good to see you. My name's Teddy. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess I've told you about my condition. TEDDY (grins)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only every time I see ya! Come on, I'll buy you lunch. 44   INT. DINER - DAY <<colour sequence="">> </colour> Teddy pours ketchup all over his steak. Leonard plays wit his food. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not hungry?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEONARD (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my condition. I never know if I've already eaten, so I always just eat small amounts. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to remember to be hungry. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's weird, but if you don't eat for a while then your body stops being hungry. You get sort of shaky but you don't realize you haven't eaten. Have I told you about Sammy Jankis? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. I heard enough about him. Tell me about John G. You still think he's here, right? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy you're looking for, Johnny G. That's why you haven't left. Am I right? Leonard shrugs. Teddy licks his fingers and frowns. TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard, you need to be very careful. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the other day you made it sound like you thought somebody might be trying to set you up. Get you to kill the wrong guy. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well I go on facts, not recommendations, okay? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny, you can't trust a man's life to your little notes and pictures. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're relying on them alone. You Don't remember what you've discovered or how. Your notes might be unreliable. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Memory's unreliable. Teddy snorts. LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, really. Memory's not perfect. It's not even that good. Ask the police, eyewitness testimony is unreliable. The cops don't catch a killer by sitting around remembering stuff. They collect facts, make notes, draw conclusions. Facts, not memories: that's how you investigate. I know, it's what I used to do. Memory can change the shape of a room or the color of a car. It's an interpretation, not a record. Memories can be changed or distorted and they're irrelevant if you have the facts. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really want to find this guy? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He took away the woman I love and he took away my memory. He destroyed everything; my life and my ability to live. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're living. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for revenge. That's what keeps me going. It's all I have. Teddy considers this. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll find him. Where are you staying? Leonard reaches into his pocket and takes out a Polaroid. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Discount Inn. Don't know what room; haven't got my key. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably left it in your room. MEMENTO Blue Revisions - 8/27/99

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 45   EXT. DISCOUNT INN - DAY <<colour sequence="">> </colour> The Jaguar pulls up. Leonard gets out and heads to the office. 46   INT. DISCOUNT INN OFFICE - DAY <<colour sequence= </colour> Leonard enters. Burt is behind the counter reading a magazine. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I think I'm checked in here, but I've misplaced my key. BURT (looks up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Leonard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard (in boxers, bandaged arm shaving foam on thigh, strides the row, talking on the phone and gesticulating w a disposable razor. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Sammy can't learn any new skills. But I find something in my research: Conditioning. Sammy should still be able to learn through repetition. It's how  you learn stuff like riding a bike, things you don't think about, you just get better through practice. Call it muscle memory, whatever, but it's a completely different part of the brain from the short-term memory. So I have the doctors test Sammy's response to conditioning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammy sits at a table. A DOCTOR sits opposite pointing ou various METAL OBJECTS sitting on the table. DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just pick up any three objects. SAMMY (amused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a test? Where were you guys when I did my CPA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sammy PICKS UP an object and gestures to the Doctor for applause. Sammy goes for a second object, but gets a SHOC which makes him recoil in pain. (LEONARD TO SUBSTITUTE) SAMMY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! What the fuck?! Sammy looks ACCUSINGLY at the Doctor. DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a test, Sammy. LEONARD (V.O.)

dialogues.text: Some of the objects were electrified, They'd give him a small shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kept repeating the test, always with the same objects electrified. The point was to see if he could learn to avoid the electrified objects. Not by memory, but by instinct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FURNISHED - MORNING <<colour sequence="">> </colour> Leonard opens his eyes, naked in bed. He looks around, confused. With a START, he realizes that someone else is the bed: a BRUNETTE with her back to him. Leonard leans right over her to get a look at her face. I NATALIE. The BRUISE on her eye and the MARK on her lip ar worse than before. She OPENS her eyes and is startled by the sight of Leonar hovering face. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. It's only me. Leonard FLOPS down. Natalie wakes up fully and relaxes. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep okay? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You? Natalie shrugs. She looks at her bedside clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Blue Revisions - 8/27/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta be someplace. She gets out of bed, wearing pajamas. Leonard swings his out of the bed and realizes that he is wearing trousers a socks. He looks at his tattoos, as if he has never seen t before. NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.text: Pretty weird. She is smiling at him in the mirror. Leonard smiles, shru LEONARD

dialogues.text: Useful. You never write a phone number on your hand? NATALIE (through mirror)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should be able to talk to my friend about the license plate today. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the license plate... NATALIE (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John G's license plate number. You have it tattooed on your thigh. Natalie leaves the room. Leonard pulls down his trousers reveal two tattoos:

dialogues.speaker: "FACT 6
dialogues.text: Leonard runs his finger over fact 6, then pulls his trous up and looks around the room. He spots his suit jacket hanging over the back of a chair. He checks the pockets, pulls out his Polaroids, flips through them: a Jaguar, th Discount Inn, Natalie. He flips Natalie's picture over an looks at the back. There are two messages, but the first has been completely scribbled over. The other one reads:

dialogues.speaker: "HAS ALSO LOST SOMEONE, SHE WILL HELP YOU OUT OF PITY"
dialogues.text: Leonard stuffs the photos back into his pocket, grabs a w shirt of f the chair and pulls it on. Natalie comes back and starts to apply her makeup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's registered in this state it'll just take seconds to pull up his license and registration. I'll call when I've spoken to him. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we just arrange a meeting now? I'm not too good on the phone. Natalie takes her eye pencil and writes a NOTE on a SMALL FROM A PHARMACY. Leonard puts his jacket on. Natalie offe him the note. It says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEONARD (cont'd) (leading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's great that you would... that you're helping me like this... NATALIE (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm helping you because you helped me. Leonard nods. NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So will you remember me next time you seo me? Leonard shakes his head and reaches for the note. Natalie grabs his lapel and pulls him down to her, kissing him ge on the mouth. NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you will. LEONARD (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Leonard heads for the door. NATALIE (amused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny, before you go, can I have my shirt back please? She tosses him his blue shirt. Leonard looks down at the white shirt which he has put on. It is way too small. 51   EXT. MAIN STREET - DAY <<colour sequence="">> </colour> The Jaguar pulls up to a red light. Suddenly Teddy is ban on the window. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny! I thought you'd gone for good. What brings you back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard (in boxers, bandaged arm) STRIDES the room, shavi foam on leg, razor in one hand, phone in the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kept testing Sammy for months, always with the same objects carrying the electrical charge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammy sits across the testing table from the Doctor. Samm goes for a METAL OBJECT and RECOILS in pain from a SHOCK. SAMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! What the fuck?! DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a test, Sammy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS BEFORE, but Sammy is DRESSED DIFFERENTLY. He goes for object and is SHOCKED. SAMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! What the fuck?! DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a test, Sammy. SAMMY EXTENDS A TREMBLING MIDDLE FINGER. SAMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Test this you fucking quack. Sequence of JUMP CUTS of Sammy extending his MIDDLE FINGE and RECOILING in shock from the objects. LEONARD (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even with total short-term memory loss, Sammy should've learned to instinctively stop picking up the wrong objects. All previous cases of short-term memory loss had responded to conditioning in some way. Sammy didn't respond at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was enough to suggest his condition was psychological not physical. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We turned down his claim on the grounds that he wasn't covered for mental illness. Sammy's wife got stuck with the bills and I got a promotion for rejecting a big claim. Leonard looks into the mirror. LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conditioning didn't work for Sammy, so he became helpless. But it works for me. I live the way Sammy couldn't. Habit and Conditioning. Acting on instinct. 56   EXT./INT. NATALIE'S FRONT DOOR - DUSK <<colour se </colour> Leonard pulls up in his Jaguar, gets out, rings the front doorbell. It is opened by Natalie. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie, right? Natalie nods, wary of Leonard's barely concealed anger. Leonard thrusts a Polaroid photo in her face. LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck is Dodd? The photo is of a MAN who is BOUND, GAGGED, and BLOODY. O the back of the photo:

dialogues.speaker: "GET RID OF HIM, ASK NATALIE"
dialogues.text: Natalie takes the picture and examines it. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess I don't have to worry about him anymore. LEONARD (snaps)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he? What have you got me into? Natalie looks up and down the street. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: <<colour sequence="">> </colour> Natalie shows Leonard in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Blue Revisions - 8/27/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down. You're not into anything. It was my problem, you offered no help. It's got nothing to do with your investigation. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the problem! How can I find John G. when I don't know what's going on?! How did you get me into this?! NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard, you offered to help when you saw what this guy did to me. She gestures at the BRUISING on her face. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I know he did that to you? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to you straight after he did it. I showed you what he'd done and asked for your help. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I just take your word? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. LEONARD (sighs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something feels wrong. I think someone's fucking with me. Trying to get me to kill the wrong guy. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill him. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Course not. Natalie waves the Polaroid at him.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has nothing to do with you. You helped me out, and I'm grateful. She tries to rip the picture. Leonard watches her try. Th plastic is too strong. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to burn them. Natalie scrunches it up and throws it down. Leonard and Natalie sit down on the couch. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You decided to help me. Trust yourself. Trust your own judgment. You can question everything, you can never know anything for sure. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are things you know for sure. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such as? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the feel of the world. (reaches forward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how this wood will sound when I knock. (raps knuckles on coffee table)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how this glass will feel when I pick it up. (handles glass)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainties. You think it's knowledge, but it's a kind of memory, a kind you take for granted. I can remember so much. (runs hands over objects)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the feel of the world, (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and I know her. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wife? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gone and the present is trivia, which I can scribble down as notes. Natalie stares at Leonard, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax a little, okay? Take off your jacket. Leonard takes his jacket off and places it on the back of couch, patting the pockets as he does so. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not easy to be calm when - NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just relax. She reaches for his arm and unbuttons his cuff, revealing end of Leonard's tattoos. NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't seem the type. She pushes back the sleeve, trying to read the tattoo. Leonard watches her. NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. She starts to unbutton his shirt. He watches. Natalie gas as she opens Leonard's shirt and pulls it back over his shoulders. She tilts her head, trying to read the differe messages. NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's backwards. She pulls him up and turns him around in front of the mir to read the backwards tattoo across his chest. "JOHN G. RAPED AND MURDERED MY WIFE". Natalie touches the blank area of skin above Leonard's he NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here? Leonard looks down at the blank patch, then at Natalie, vulnerable, confused. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's... it must be for when I've found him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Leonard. Leonard shrugs. Natalie studies Leonard's chest, avoiding his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've lost somebody. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Natalie picks up a photograph from off a messy desk in th corner. She shows it to Leonard. The picture shows Natali smiling and hugging a smirking YOUNG MAN (JIMMY). Natalie looks up at Leonard to see his reaction. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name was Jimmy. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went to meet somebody and didn't come back. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did he go to meet? Natalie studies Leonard. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guy called Teddy. Leonard does not react to the name. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do the police think? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't look too hard for guys like Jimmy. Natalie puts the photo down. She reaches out to Leonard, spreading her fingers over the blank part of his chest. NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you find this guy, this John G., what are you going to do? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill him. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I can help you find him. I know a lot of people. 58   INT. NATALIE'S BEDROOM - NIGHT <<colour sequence= </colour> Natalie, eyes closed, has her head on Leonard's chest. He shirtless, lying on top of the covers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know how long she's been gone. It's like I've woken up in bed and she's not here because she's gone to the bathroom or something. But somehow I just know that she'll never come back to bed. I lie here, not knowing how long I've been alone. If I could just reach out and touch her side of the bed I could know that it was cold, but I can't. I have no idea when she left. Natalie's eyes are open. LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I can't have her back, but I want to be able to let her go. I don't want to wake up every morning thinking she's still here then realizing that she's not. I want time to pass, but it won't. How can I heal if I can't feel time? Leonard bends his head around to see if Natalie is awake. closes her eyes. Leonard gingerly slides from underneath and moves silently out of the bedroom. 59   INT. NATALIE'S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT <<colour seque </colour> Leonard enters the dark room. He goes to the couch and pi up his shirt and his jacket. He notices the photograph wh Natalie showed him on top of some papers on a desk in the corner. He holds it in a shaft of light from the streetla outside, studying the photo of Natalie and Jimmy. 60   INT. NATALIE'S BEDROOM - NIGHT <<colour sequence= </colour> Natalie, eyes open, slides her hand over to where Leonard lying, feeling his residual warmth. ii        61   INT. NATALIE'S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT <<co 61 Leonard has his Polaroid photograph of Natalie out. He ta a pen out of his jacket, rests the photo against the wall a patch of light and writes on the back, underneath the message which has been scribbled out:

dialogues.speaker: "SHE HAS ALSO LOST SOMEONE. SHE WILL HELP YOU OUT OF PITY
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 62   INT. NATALIE'S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS - NIGHT <<col Leonard enters, deposits his jacket and shirt, then slide into bed next to Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard lies on the bed (in boxers, bandaged arm) talking the phone. He wipes the excess shaving foam from his thig and feels the SMOOTHNESS of the clean-shaven skin. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammy's wife was crippled by the cost of supporting him and fighting the company's decision - but it wasn't the money that got to her.

dialogues.speaker: SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: Mrs. Jankis comes into the room. Sammy is seated, watchin T.V. He looks up at her with a smile. She smiles back, te LEONARD (V.0.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never said that Sammy was faking. Just that his problem was mental, not physical. But she... she couldn't understand. She looks into his eyes and sees the same person. And if it's not a physical problem... Sammy's Wife starts shouting at Sammy. Sammy squirms. LEONARD (V.0.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... he should just... snap out of it. Sammy's Wife THROWS her drink in Sammy's face, puts her h in her hands, SOBBING. Sammy wipes his face on his sleeve

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard, talking on the phone, empties the white paper ba onto the bed beside him: Two cheap BALL-POINT PENS, SCOTC TAPE, a pack of NEEDLES, and a FILE CARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So good old Leonard Shelby from the insurance company gives her the seed of doubt, just like he gave it to the doctors. But I never said that Sammy was faking. I never said that. Leonard takes a NEEDLE out of the packet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - NIGHT <<colour sequence="">> </colour> We move along a hallway towards a closed door. An ominous rumbling builds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glass bottle SHATTERS against black and white ceramic tiles. A SUDDEN MOVEMENT glimpsed through a water-beaded clear plastic shower curtain. The shower curtain pulls TAUT across a GASPING FEMALE FAC Leonard's REFLECTION in a MIRROR which SHATTERS. 67   INT. DODD'S MOTEL ROOM - DAY <<colour sequence="" </colour> Leonard opens his eyes, frightened. He is lying on the be his beige suit and blue shirt. LEONARD (V.0.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awake. He rolls his eyes to one side. LEONARD (V.O.)(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I? He lifts his head and surveys the room. LEONARD (V.O.)(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motel room. He rises from the bed, looking at the room as if for the first time. He starts looking in the dresser drawers, fin nothing. LEONARD (V.O.)(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some anonymous motel room. Nothing in the drawers, but you look anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He grasps the handle of the bedside drawer. LEONARD (V.O.) (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never anything but the Gideon... Leonard pulls the drawer open, and pauses at what he sees LEONARD (V.O.) (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Bible. In the drawer is a Gideon Bible. Resting on top of it is HANDGUN. Leonard turns, looks over the rest of the room. He moves the bureau and opens drawers. Empty. He goes to the close and OPENS it. Inside is a BOUND and GAGGED MAN on the floor, knees agai chest. His mouth is taped up with silver electrical tape, stained with DRIED BLOOD from his swollen nose. He looks at Leonard, blinking in the sudden bright light, TERRIFIE Leonard SHUTS the closet door, CONFUSED. The Man in the closet starts GRUNTING and BUMPING the closet door. There is a KNOCK at the door. Leonard looks through the peephole. 68   INT./EXT. DODD'S MOTEL - DAY <<colour sequence="" </colour>

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FISH-EYE TEDDY, grinning and waving. 69   INT. DODD'S MOTEL - DAY <<colour sequence="">> </colour> Leonard looks around, trying to think. Teddy KNOCKS harde The Man in the closet BUMPS and GROANS. Leonard reaches i his pocket and pulls out some Polaroids. LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute! He finds the one of Teddy, then sticks them back into his pocket. He OPENS the door to Teddy and grins. LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teddy! Teddy brushes past him into the room. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finished playing with yourself, Lenny?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Teddy SLUMPS into a chair. Leonard tries to smile. There faint GRUNTING and BUMPING from inside the closet. Teddy notices the noise and grins. TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get it - amorous neighbors. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here? TEDDY (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You called me. You wanted my help. You know, Lenny, I've had more rewarding friendships than this one. Although I do get to keep using the same jokes. Leonard thinks, then moves to the CLOSET and OPENS the do Teddy looks in DISBELIEF at the Man in the closet. TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck is that? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know him? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Should I? Leonard shrugs. TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this John G.? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think so? You don't know? Didn't you write it down? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might have fallen asleep before I did. Teddy shakes his head, chuckling. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask him. Leonard crouches down and RIPS the tape from the Man's mo LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Man looks at Leonard, wary, says nothing. Leonard twe his broken nose. The Man groans. LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name. MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodd. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did this to you? DODD (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did this to you? DODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did. Leonard replaces the gag and SHUTS the closet. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna help you kill this guy, if that's what - LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No, just let me think for a minute. Leonard moves to the dresser and starts methodically empt his pockets. He pulls a Polaroid out of his inside jacket pocket. LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go. The Polaroid shows Dodd sitting on the bed, BOUND, GAGGED BLEEDING. The name Dodd is written below the picture. Leo flips it over. On the back it says:

dialogues.speaker: "GET RID OF HIM, THEN ASK NATALIE"
dialogues.text: Teddy looks at the photo over Leonard's shoulder. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie? Natalie who? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I know her. Leonard sticks his pictures in his pocket. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to get him out of here. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got to have a car, right? We just take him back to his car and tell him to get the fuck out of town before we kill him. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't just walk him out tied up and bleeding. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd ya get him in here in the first place? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Leonard looks around the room for inspiration. LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do... this isn't my room. Teddy looks around at the anonymous room. LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's his. He was already here. Let's just go. Leonard starts for the door, Teddy lays a hand on his che TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, we can't just leave him. The maid finds him, calls the cops. He's seen us now Leonard thinks. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. We clean him up, untie him and march him out with a gun in his back. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I have a gun? Leonard fishes the HANDGUN out of the bedside table drawe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be his. I don't think they'd let someone like me carry a gun. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking hope not. Leonard covers Dodd with the gun while Teddy pulls him ou the closet. Dodd has trouble standing up straight. MEMENTO Pink Revisions -  9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 70   EXT. DODD'S MOTEL - DAY <<colour sequence="">> </colour> Teddy exits the room, glances around, motions for Leonard Dodd to follow. Dodd is cleaned up and unbound, Leonard i pressed up right behind him. The three of them descend to parking lot. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one? Dodd leads them to a new LANDCRUISER. Teddy whispers in Leonard's ear. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We probably ought to take his car, you know, teach him a lesson. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut it, Teddy. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy for you to say, you've got the Jag. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll ride with him. You follow. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your keys. Leonard looks at him, suspicious. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your own car. Teddy shrugs. Leonard motions Dodd into the driver's seat then slides into the passenger side. They pull out of the parking lot, Teddy following in his GREY SEDAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Landcruiser PULLS OVER and stops. The grey sedan pull behind. Leonard gets out of the Landcruiser and it PULLS at speed. Leonard walks back to Teddy's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So was he scared? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think it was your sinister mustache that got him.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Teddy leans over slightly so that he can see his reflecti in the rear view mirror. Leonard smiles. Teddy sees him. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. We shoulda taken his car. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with this one? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like it? Let's trade. 73   EXT. ALLEY BEHIND THE MOTEL - DAY <<colour sequen </colour> The grey sedan pulls up beside Leonard's Jaguar. Leonard out. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you gonna do now? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna ask Natalie what the fuck that was all about. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie who? Leonard ignores him and gets into his Jaguar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: <<colour sequence="">> </colour> The Jaguar pulls up. Leonard checks the address against t address written on his Polaroid of Natalie, then goes to door and RINGS the bell. It is opened by Natalie. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie, right? Natalie nods, wary of Leonard's tone. Leonard THRUSTS a Polaroid in her face. LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Leonard picks up the NEEDLE/PEN and continues his tattoo. 115  EXT. NATALIE'S HOUSE - DAY <<colour sequence="">& </colour> The CAR ALARM of the Jaguar is SOUNDING. Leonard exits, walks to the car and gets in, switching of the alarm. TEDDY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should lock a car as nice as this. Teddy is in the passenger seat. Leonard, startled, GRABS by the throat. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you? TEDDY (gasping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teddy. Your buddy. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prove it. TEDDY (gasping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammy. Remember Sammy. You told me about Sammy. Leonard lets him go. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing in my car? Teddy is now wearing his big grin, rubbing his neck.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sense of humour went with the memory, huh? You know why you're still here, don't you? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfinished business. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny, as a buddy, let me inform you. Your business here is very much finished. You're still here because of Natalie. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's she? Teddy chuckles. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose house do you think you just walked out of? Leonard looks at the house. Teddy motions towards Leonard pockets. TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a look at your pictures, I bet you got one of her. Leonard pulls out his Polaroids and flips through them. H pauses at the one of Natalie. Teddy SWIPES it out of his hands to get a better look at the blurred image of Natali turning in a doorway. TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great shot, Lenny. Teddy flips the photo over. There is nothing on the back. Teddy hands it back to Leonard. TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna make a note that you can't trust her. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's that? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she'll have taken one look at your clothes and your car and started thinking of ways to turn the situation to her advantage. She's already got you staying with her, for fuck's sake. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't stay with her. Let me give you the name of a motel. Teddy starts looking for a piece of paper. TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thing I found you. She's bad news. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean "bad news"? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's involved with these drug dealers. Teddy opens the GLOVE COMPARTMENT, finding a STACK OF BEE MATS from a local bar called FERDY'S. TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See these? That's the bar where she works. Her boyfriend's a drug dealer. She'd take orders for him, arrange meets. He'd write messages on these, then leave it on the bar. She'd drop replies when she served him drinks. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should I care? Teddy starts writing on the BEER MAT. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gonna use you. To protect herself. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From who? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys who'll come after her. Guys who'll want to know what happened to her boyfriend. They'll want to make somebody pay. Maybe she'll try and make it you. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well maybe she'll make it you. Is that it? You worried she'll use me against you? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She couldn't. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Blue Revisions - 8/27/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TEDDY (grins)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has no idea who I am. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you following me? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to help you. I knew she'd get her claws into you. She doesn't know anything about your investigation, so when she offers to help you, it'll be for her own reasons. Why would I lie? Do not go back to her. Take out a pen, write yourself a note, do not trust her. Leonard takes out his pen, places the picture of Natalie down on the dash and writes on the white strip on the bac

dialogues.speaker: "DON'T TRUST HER"
dialogues.text: LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy now? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't be happy until you leave town. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do you think you can hang around here before people start asking questions? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What sort of questions? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sort of questions you should be asking yourself. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like how'd you get this car? That suit? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have money.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From what? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife's death. I used to work in Insurance, we were well covered. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So in your grief you wandered into a Jaguar dealership? Leonard says nothing. Teddy laughs. TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't got a clue, have you? You don't even know who you are? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do. I don't have amnesia. I remember everything about myself up until the incident. I'm Leonard Shelby, I'm from San Fran - TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's who you were, Lenny. You don't know who you are, who you've become since the incident. You're wandering around, playing detective... and you don't even know how long ago it was. Teddy reaches out to Leonard's lapel, and gently opens hi jacket to reveal the label. TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it this way. Were you wearing designer suits when you sold insurance? Leonard looks down at his suit, then back to Teddy. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't sell - TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, you investigated. Maybe you need to apply some of your investigative skills to yourself. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, thanks for the advice. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go back in there. There's a motel out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Blue Revisions - 8/27/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Teddy hands Leonard the BEER MAT and gets out of the car. TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been fun, Lenny. Teddy walks off. Leonard pulls his Polaroids out of his pocket and finds the one of Teddy. He places it on the da face up, next to the one of Natalie which is still face d on the dash. Leonard reads the message he has written on back of Natalie's picture:

dialogues.speaker: "DON'T TRUST HER"
dialogues.text: He flips Teddy's picture over, like a croupier turning a at blackjack. On the back it says:

dialogues.speaker: "DON'T BELIEVE HIS LIES"
dialogues.text: Leonard purses his lips in surprised frustration. He grab his pen and scribbles on the back of Natalie's picture, obliterating the words:

dialogues.speaker: "DON'T TRUST HER"
dialogues.text: He flips Natalie's picture over and considers her blurred image. He looks up at her house, then picks up the BEER M reading the address Teddy has given him. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck it. I need my own place. Leonard starts the engine. 116  EXT. DISCOUNT INN - DAY <<colour sequence="">> </colour> Leonard pulls up in his Jaguar, checks the name of the mo against the note written on the BEER MAT, then heads into office to check in. Leonard comes out of the office, takes a Polaroid of the  front of the motel, and heads for Room 304.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard (boxers, bandaged arm) talks on the phone. He pre the NEEDLE/PEN against his thigh, working on a "D". LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't blame the cops for not taking me seriously. This is a difficult condition for people to understand. I mean look at Sammy Jankis. His own wife couldn't deal with it. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEONARD (cont'd) (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you about how she tried to get him to snap out of it? (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It got much worse than that. Eventually Sammy's wife came to see me at the office, and I found out all kinds of shit. (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knew that I was the one who had built he case for Sammy faking it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard, in a CHEAP SUIT AND TIE, gets up from behind his desk to shake hands with Mrs. Jankis. They talk, Leonard nodding as he listens. Mrs. Jankis is crying. LEONARD (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told me about life with Sammy, how she'd treated him. It had got to the point where she'd get Sammy to hide food all around the house, then stop feeding him to see if his hunger would make him remember where he'd hidden the stuff. She wasn't a cruel person, she just wanted her old Sammy back. The tearful Mrs. Jankis gives Leonard a determined look. MRS. JANKIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Shelby, you know all about Sammy and you decided that he was faking - LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Jankis, the company's position isn't that Sammy is "faking" anything, just that his condition can't be shown - MRS. JANKIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not interested in the company position, Mr. Shelby. I want to know your honest opinion about Sammy. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We shouldn't even be talking this way while the case is still open to appeal. MRS. JANKIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not appealing the decision. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MRS. JANKIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Shelby, try and understand. When I look into Sammy's eyes, I don't see some vegetable, I see the same old Sammy. What do you think it's like for me to suspect that he's imagining this whole problem? That if I could just say the right thing he'd snap out of it and be back to normal? If I knew that my old Sammy was truly gone, then I could say goodbye and start loving this new Sammy. As long as I have doubt, I can't say goodbye and move on. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Jankis, what do you want from me? MRS. JANKIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to forget the company you work for for thirty seconds, and tell me if you really think that Sammy is faking his condition. Leonard plays with his letter opener, thinking. MRS. JANKIS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to know what you honestly believe. LEONARD (looks at Mrs. Jankis)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe that Sammy should be physically capable of making new memories. MRS. JANKIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She seemed to leave happy. I thought I'd helped her. Leonard puts the NEEDLE/PEN down, and wipes blood from hi homemade TATTOO, which says:

dialogues.speaker: "FACT 5. DRUG DEALER"
dialogues.text: LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought she just needed some kind of answer. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think it was important to her what the answer was, just that she had one to believe. Leonard notices the BANDAGE on his LEFT ARM. He starts fiddling with the TAPE, peeling back the corners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 120  INT. NATALIE'S LIVING ROOM - DAY <<colour sequenc </colour> Leonard sifts through the papers on the desk, agitated. H hears a car door SLAM. He looks out of the window to see Natalie getting out of her car. She turns and comes towards the front door. Her face is S and BLEEDING. Leonard OPENS the door for her. She RUSHES past him. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? Natalie, intensely AGITATED, FUMBLES with things in her p NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it look like?! She turns to Leonard so that he can see the full extent o her injuries. Her eye is SWELLING UP, and her lip is SPLI NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He beat the shit out of me. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?! Fuck, Leonard! Dodd! Dodd beat the shit out of me. Natalie FLINGS her purse to the ground in frustration. Sh does not know what to do with her hands. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Natalie turns to him, ENRAGED. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of you, you fucking idiot! Because I did what you told me! (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to him, reason with him, tell him about Teddy! Great fucking ideal Leonard APPROACHES her, palms out. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down. Natalie starts to HIT Leonard. He takes her arms. LEONARD (cont'd) (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy. You're safe now. You're safe. He sits her down on the couch. LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get some ice on your face.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Natalie, crying softly, holds a paper towel filled with i cubes to her swollen cheek while Leonard gently uses a da paper towel to wipe the blood from her upper lip. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did exactly what you told me. I went to Dodd and I said that I didn't have Jimmy's money, or any drugs, that this Teddy must have taken everything. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what did he say? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't believe me. He said that if I don't get him the money tomorrow he's gonna kill me. Then he started hitting me. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go see him. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him some bruises of his own and tell him to look for a guy called Teddy. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll kill you, Lenny. LEONARD (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife used to call me Lenny. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I hated it. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy's dangerous, let's think of something else. Leonard takes out a piece of paper but he cannot find his pen. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of it. Just tell me what he looks like, and where I can find him. Do you have a pen? Natalie gets a pen out of her purse and hands it to him. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll probably find you. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? Why would he be interested in me? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him about your car. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you do that? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was beating the crap out of me! I had to tell him something! Leonard hands Natalie the piece of paper and pen. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just write it all down. What he looks like, where I find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Natalie hands him a note. It says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: "PUT HIM ON TO TEDDY OR JUST GET RID OF HIM FOR NATALIE"
dialogues.text: Outside, a CAR ALARM starts to sound. Leonard gets up and heads to the door, flipping through his Polaroids. 121  EXT. NATALIE'S HOUSE - DAY <<colour sequence="">& </colour> The Jaguar's CAR ALARM is sounding. Leonard exits Natalie's house, walks to his Jaguar and ge in, silencing the alarm. TEDDY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should lock a car as nice as this. Leonard, startled, GRABS Teddy by the throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard, in boxers, bandage on arm, sits on the edge of the bed talking on the phone. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she shouldn't have given me that responsibility. Shit, I'm not a doctor, I'm a claims investigator. Leonard crooks his neck to hold the receiver between ear shoulder and FIDDLES with the BANDAGE ON HIS LEFT ARM, starting to peel back the tape, t.zying to look under the cotton pad. LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose, but I've got all sorts of other considerations. Leonard starts to REMOVE THE BANDAGE. LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Legal responsibility, and large financial...

dialogues.speaker: "NEVER ANSWER THE PHONE"
dialogues.text: Leonard looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this? He takes the receiver away from his ear as if the caller just hung up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 123  INT. NATALIE'S LIVING ROOM - DAY <<colour sequenc </colour> Leonard is sitting on the coffee table, relaxed, looking his Polaroids. Natalie (WITHOUT BRUISES) BURSTS in throug the front door, scared. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody's come. Already. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calls himself Dodd. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he want? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wants to know what happened to Jimmy. And his money. He thinks I have it. He thinks I took it. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this all about? Natalie looks at him bitterly. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know, do you? You're blissfully ignorant, aren't you? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have this condition -

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know about your fucking condition, Leonard! I probably know more about it than you do! You don't have a fucking clue about anything else! LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened is that Jimmy went to meet a guy called Teddy. He took a lot of money with him and he didn't come back. Jimmy's partners think I set him up. I don't know whether you know this Teddy or how well - Leonard is getting frustrated. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither do I. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't protect him. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get rid of Dodd for me. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill him. I'll pay you. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think I am?! I'm not gonna kill someone for money. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What then? Love? What would you kill for? For your wife, right? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's different.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to me! I wasn't fucking married to her! LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk about my wife. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can talk about whoever the fuck I want! You won't even remember what I say! I can tell you that your wife was a fucking whore and we can still be friends! Leonard stands up. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's easy for you to say! You can't get scared, you don't remember how, you fucking idiot! LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just take it easy, this isn't my fault. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it is! How the fuck would you know?! You don't know a fucking thing! You can't get scared, can you get angry?! Leonard steps towards her. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You pathetic piece of shit. I can say whatever the fuck I want and you won't have a clue, you fucking retard. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up! Natalie gets right in his face, grinning. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna use you, you stupid fuck. I'm telling you now because I'll enjoy it more if I know that you could stop me if you weren't a freak.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Leonard grabs his Polaroids and finds one of Natalie. He reaches into his pocket for a pen, but cannot find one. NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost your pen? That's too bad, freak. Otherwise you could've written yourself a little note about how much Natalie hates your retarded guts. Leonard moves around the room searching for a pen. Natali follows him, speaking into his ear. NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No pens here, I'm afraid. You're never going to know that I called you a retard, and your wife a whore. Leonard turns to face her, barely controlling his anger. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say another fucking word! NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About your whore of a wife? Leonard slaps Natalie. She smiles, then speaks softly. NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read about your problem. You know what one of the causes of short term memory loss is? Leonard fumes. NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venereal disease. Maybe your cunt of a wife sucked one too many diseased cocks and turned you into a retard. Leonard turns away, body tensed, ready to snap. Natalie reaches out to gently brush the hair above his ear with h fingers. NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sad freak, you won't remember any of what I've said, and we'll be best friends, or even lovers. Leonard spins around, BACKHANDING Natalie on the cheek. He PUNCHES her in the mouth then pushes her to the floor. stands over her, furious with himself as much as her.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Natalie gets to her feet, and goes to the door. She turns Leonard. Her face is bloody but she smiles. NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you soon. Natalie exits. Leonard watches her walk out to her car an get in. She just sits there. Leonard turns from the window and looks around the room. grabs at drawers, searching for a pen. He looks back out window. Natalie is still sitting in her car. Leonard is sifting through the papers on the desk when he hears a ca door SLAM. He looks out of the window to see Natalie gett out of her car. She turns to walk toward the house. Her f is swollen and bloody. Leonard opens the door for her. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? Natalie, intensely AGITATED, FUMBLES with things in her purse. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it look like? 124  INT. MOTEL ROOM 21 - DAY <<black and="" sequence= </black> Leonard lies on the bed, in jeans, topless. He reaches fo ringing phone with his left arm. As his hand reaches the receiver Leonard reads the tattoo on his arm which says:

dialogues.speaker: "NEVER ANSWER THE PHONE"
dialogues.text: Leonard strokes the tattoo as he lets the phone ring. It stops. Leonard goes to the door, opens it and checks the number of the room: 21. He goes back to the phone, makes call. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Front desk? Burt, right. Well, this is Mr. Shelby in Room 21. I don't want any calls, none at all, got it? Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 125  EXT. NATALIE'S HOUSE - DAY <<colour sequence="">& </colour> Leonard's Jaguar pulls up. Leonard and Natalie (WITHOUT BRUISES) get out. Leonard is carrying his sports bag. 126  INT. NATALIE'S LIVING ROOM - DAY <<colour sequenc </colour> Natalie leads Leonard in, self-conscious about her messy living room. NATALIE
