dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because that cop's looking for you. We need to get you a change of identity. Some new clothes and a different car should do for now. Put these on. Teddy offers the bag of clothes. Leonard refuses it. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What cop? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This bad cop. He checked you into the Discount Inn. Then he's been calling you for days, sticking envelopes under your door, telling you shit. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Envelopes? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows you're no good on the phone, so he calls you up to bullshit you. Sometimes you stop taking his calls, so he slips something under your door to frighten you into answering your phone again. He's been pretending to help you. Feeding you a line of crap about John G. being some local drug dealer. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know this? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cos he fucking told me. He thinks it's funny. He's laughing at you. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know him? TEDDY (glances around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a snitch. He's a cop from out of town looking for information. The local boys put us in touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Leonard takes the plastic bag. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he want to know from you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanted to know all, about Jimmy Grantz. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy's a drug dealer. This cop wanted to know all about how he sets up deals, shit like that. He's got some score in mind and you're involved. Come on, there's no time to argue - if he knew I was helping you he'd find a way to kill me. Just get these clothes on. You're gonna take my car and get the fuck out of here. Leonard heads back into the curtained cubicle with the plastic bag of clothes. MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: <<colour sequence="">> </colour> Leonard drops the plastic bag and takes his jacket off. H feels something in the pocket, sticks his hand in and pul out a charred Polaroid photograph. Leonard examines it, PUZZLED. All that is visible is AN A lying on a floor. Leonard reaches into the other pocket a pulls out his POLAROIDS, flicking through them until he f the one of Teddy. He flips it over and checks the back:

dialogues.speaker: "DON'T BELIEVE HIS LIES"
dialogues.text: Leonard reacts with amused RELIEF. LEONARD (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sneaky fuck. "Bad Cop". Had me going. Leonard puts his jacket back on, checks the other pockets finds a BEER MAT for a local bar named FERDY'S. There is message written on it:

dialogues.speaker: "COME BY AFTERWARDS, NATALIE"
dialogues.text: Leonard sticks it back in his pocket. He PEEKS through th curtains. Teddy is sitting by the door, waiting. Leonard looks around, NOTICES a window set high in the wall above padded bench in the cubicle. Leonard CLIMBS on the bench, OPENS the window and SQUEEZES himself through. 152  EXT. TATTOO PARLOUR ALLEYWAY - DAY - CONTINUOUS < Leonard DROPS from the window, regains his balance and hurries to his Jaguar which is parked on the street by th mouth of the alley.

dialogues.text: Leonard, in boxers and plaid work shirt, sits hunched ove the bedside table, flipping through the file as he talks the phone. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this Jimmy Grantz deals drugs out of the bar where his girlfriend works. But he'll come to the meet alone. Leonard looks down at the FRESH TATTOO on his thigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: "FACT 5
dialogues.text: He consults a file which he has drawn from his bag. LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always figured the drugs angle would be the best way to get him. No, officer, I'm ready. Ready as I'll ever be. (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're downstairs now? What do you look like? (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Leonard hangs up the phone and pulls on a pair of scruffy jeans. He grabs his Polaroid camera and puts it over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard exits and heads to the Motel office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BELL CHIMES as Leonard enters. Burt is behind the counter. A MAN stands by the free coffee. The Man TURNS AROUND. It is Teddy, with a big grin. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny! Leonard smiles cautiously, and offers his hand. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Gammell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard exits the office, followed by Teddy, and looks through his Polaroids. He finds one of a PICKUP TRUCK, sp it in the lot, and walks over to it. He turns around and points his camera at Teddy. Teddy grins wider. Leonard sn the picture. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something to remember you by. Leonard lowers the camera and takes out a pen, resting th picture against the truck, about to write on the white st beneath the developing picture. LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry - is it Officer, or Lieutenant Gammell? Teddy coughs and looks at the picture. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just Teddy. Don't write Gammell please. Leonard raises his eyebrows. TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm undercover. Here's directions. He'll be heading there now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Teddy pulls a note out of his pocket and hands it to Leon LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not coming? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't be appropriate. Leonard climbs into the truck. Teddy taps on the window. TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard? Leonard cranks it down. Teddy looks at Leonard with somet like fatherly affection. TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make him beg.

dialogues.speaker: SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: The pickup truck speeds along, past strip malls and gas stations, heading into more desolate industrialization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pickup truck bumps across the railroad tracks, then p up in front of the LARGE DERELICT BUILDING. Leonard gets of the pickup, looking around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads into the house, down the DIMLY-LIT, DECAYING FOR HALLWAY, treading carefully on the LOOSE, ROTTEN FLOORBOA He notices a door at the end of the hallway. He opens the door to see that it leads down to the basement. Leonard hears a CAR APPROACHING. He slips into the kitche and looks out the dirty, broken front windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE JAGUAR is approaching fast. It parks next to the PICK TRUCK, and the driver emerges; a young man in his 30's, smartly dressed in BEIGE SUIT and BLUE SHIRT. This is JIM the young man from Natalie's photograph. He looks at the truck then at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard steps back into the shadows of the crumbling kitc Jimmy approaches the doorway, peering into the dark hallw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teddy?! Jimmy steps cautiously inside. Leonard emerges from the kitchen. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy? JIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing here? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember me? JIMMY (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I remember you. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Jimmy Grantz? JIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Expecting any other Jimmy's out here, Memory Man? Where the fuck's Teddy? Leonard comes out of the gloom, stopping in front of Jimm studying his face. Leonard has a JACK HANDLE in his hand. JIMMY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: Leonard's wife, head wrapped in a water-beaded clear plas shower curtain, THRASHING around, GASPING for breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard HITS Jimmy around the head with the jack handle. Jimmy goes down, but STRUGGLES as Leonard drags him deepe into the dark hallway. Leonard bends over the groaning Ji frisking him, finding nothing. JIMMY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking retard, you can't get away with this - Leonard holds the jack handle above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO Blue Revisions - 8/27/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strip! Jimmy starts taking off his suit. JIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're making a big fucking mistake. My associates are not people you want - LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say anything else. JIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew I couldn't trust that fuck - LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet! Jimmy drops his shirt. LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pants, too. JIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want blood on them. JIMMY (sudden fear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Did he tell you what I was bringing? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strip! JIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, there's two hundred grand stashed in the car. Just take it! Leonard shoves Jimmy to the ground. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can bargain with me?! JIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the money and walk away! LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want your fucking money!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! What do you want from me?! Leonard looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard's wife, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard is losing it. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my fucking life back! Jimmy SWINGS at Leonard with a BROKEN FLOORBOARD, STRIKIN his shoulder. The jack handle goes flying. Jimmy SWINGS again, misses. Leonard GRABS him, taking him down. The tw them STRUGGLE on the floor. Leonard gets ON TOP of Jimmy, CHOKING him. Jimmy tries to speak, but can only make GURG noises. As Leonard watches Jimmy fight for air we:

dialogues.speaker: WHITE SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: Leonard's wife THRASHES her head from side to side, STRUGGLING to breathe though the clear plastic shower curtain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 167 Jimmy's arms THRASH, his hands catching Leonard's face, SCRATCHING his cheek. Leonard tips his head back and increases his efforts. Jimmy STOPS struggling. Leonard ke his hands around Jimmy's throat until he is confident tha is DEAD. Leonard BREATHES as he stands up. He nods to himself with satisfaction. He looks around for his POLAROID CAMERA. He snaps a FLASH picture of Jimmy's body, and stares intentl the POLAROID as it begins to DEVELOP. We see the IMAGE OF THE STRANGLED JIMMY appear <<in <b </in></colour> 168  INT. DAY - DERELICT BUILDING - CONTINUOUS <<colou </colour> Leonard stands above Jimmy's body, examining the picture has just taken, nodding to himself, catching his breath.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Leonard grabs Jimmy' s body by the legs, DRAGGING him bac towards the basement. He opens the door and BACKS down in the DARKNESS, pulling Jimmy behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: <<colour sequence="">> </colour> Leonard BACKS DOWN the stairs, dragging Jimmy's BODY, hea BUMPING down each step. In the middle of the room, Leonar DROPS the legs. Moving fast, Leonard pulls the BEIGE SUIT TROUSERS from the body, REMOVES HIS OWN SCRUFFY JEANS AND PLAID WORK SHIRT. Leonard dresses in Jimmy's BLUE SHIRT a BEIGE SUIT. He grabs the Polaroids from his PLAID WORK SH and sticks them in his suit jacket pocket. He dumps his o clothes onto Jimmy's body. A faint RASPING comes from Jim throat. Leonard, frightened, bends down to listen. JIMMY (barely and audible rasp)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammy... remember Sammy... Leonard is SHOCKED. Jimmy is silent. The sound of a CAR outside. Leonard JUMPS to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard looks out to see Teddy getting out of his GREY SE Leonard leafs through his Polaroids finding the one of Te There is nothing on the back. He sticks his Polaroids bac his pocket, pausing at the one of the STRANGLED JIMMY. LEONARD (V.0.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have I done? 171  EXT. DERELICT BUILDING - DAY <<colour sequence="" </colour> Leonard emerges to find Teddy trying the Jaguar's doors. LEONARD (distraught)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Mister! I need help! Teddy looks up. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a guy in here, hurt bad! We gotta get him to a doctor! Teddy moves towards the house. Leonard leads him in. MEMENTO Pink Revisions - 9/7/99

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 172  INT. DERELICT BUILDING - DAY - CONTINUOUS <<coulo </coulour> Teddy follows Leonard down the darkened hall. LEONARD (panicked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He might have fallen down the stairs, I don't know, I don't know what's going on, I'm confused. I have this memory thing - do I know you? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Don't worry, I'm a cop. Everything'll be okay. Is he still breathing? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Maybe just. They go down into the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: <<colour sequence="">> </colour> Teddy follows Leonard down the stairs. Jimmy's body, dres only in boxers, lies in the middle of the floor. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what were you doing here? Teddy moves to the body and crouches down to examine it. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. See, I have this condition. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I hope it's not as serious as his, 'cos this guy's dead. Leonard CRACKS Teddy over the head with the FLOORBOARD. TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FUCK, Lenny! That fucking kills! LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember me again, huh? Leonard FRISKS him, pulling out a GUN and a POLICE BADGE. LEONARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a cop. A fucking cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO  Yellow Revisions - 9/29/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and I helped you find the guy you were looking for - LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up. Teddy CRAWLS to his feet, RUBBING his head. MEMENTO  Yellow Revision - 9/29/99

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 174  INT. DERELICT BUILDING - DAY - CONTINUOUS <<colou </colour> Leonard pushes Teddy out of the basement. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you've got the wrong idea - Leonard GRABS Teddy. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that? He's not the guy. He knew me. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure he did. He raped your wife and fucked up your brain. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name's James F. Grantz, John G. Check your tattoos. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what was he bringing the two hundred grand for? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What - LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it for? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A load of amphetamine I told him I had. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a drug deal?! TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, and your thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO - Green Revisions 10/4/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy's your guy, Leonard. I just figured we'd make some money on the side. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how did he know me? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Discount Inn, he deals out of there. The guy at the front desk lets him know if anybody comes snooping around. He called Jimmy as soon as you took a picture of that dump. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're using me! Teddy looks at him, offended. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get half. Leonard THROWS him against the wall. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knew about Sammy. Why would I tell him about Sammy? TEDDY (chuckles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell everyone about Sammy. Everyone who'll listen. "Remember Sammy Jankis, remember Sammy Jankis". Great story. Gets better every time you tell it. So you lie to yourself to be happy. Nothing wrong with that - we all do. Who cares if there's a few little things you'd rather not remember? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO - Green Revisions 10-4-99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TEDDY (theatrical shrug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno... your wife surviving the assault... her not believing about your condition... the doubt tearing her up inside.., the insulin - LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Sammy, not me! I told you about Sammy - TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you've told yourself. Over and over. Conditioning yourself to believe. "learning through repetition" - LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammy let his wife kill herself! Sammy ended up in an institution - ! TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammy was a con man. A faker. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never said he was faking! I never said that! TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You exposed him for what he was: a fraud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO - Green Revisions 10-4-99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wrong! That's the whole point! Sammy's wife came to me and - TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammy didn't have a wife. Leonard freezes, staring at Teddy. TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was your wife who had diabetes. Leonard thinks. 175  INT. LEONARD'S APARTMENT - DAY <<colour sequence= </colour> Leonard's Wife sitting on the edge of the bed. She feels sharp pain, and turns to Leonard (just as we have seen before). LEONARD'S WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentle. Leonard has a syringe in his hand. 176  INT. DERELICT BUILDING - DAY <<colour sequence="" </colour> Leonard shakes his head, clearing his head of the image. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife wasn't diabetic. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure? 177  INT. LEONARD'S APARTMENT - DAY <<colour sequence= </colour> Leonard's Wife on the edge of the bed. She feels a sharp pain, and turns to Leonard. LEONARD'S WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO - Green Revisions 10-4-99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Leonard is playfully pinching her thigh. 178  INT. DERELICT BUILDING - DAY <<colour sequence="" </colour> Leonard shakes his head, smiling. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wasn't diabetic. You think I don't know my own wife? What the fuck is wrong with you? TEDDY (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I can only make you believe the things you want to be true, huh? Like ol' Jimmy down there. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's not the right guy! TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was to you. Come on, Lenny, you got your revenge - just enjoy it while you still remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO - Green Revisions 10-4-99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TEDDY (chuckles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What difference does it make whether he was your guy or not? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It makes all the difference. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? You're never going to know. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I will. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you won't. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somehow, I'll know! TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't remember! LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When it's done, I'll know! It'll be different! TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought so too! I was sure you'd remember. But you didn't. Beat. Leonard looks at Teddy, questioning. TEDDY (off look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, when we found your guy and killed him. (off look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, the real John G. Over a year ago. I helped you find him. He's already dead. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you keep lying to me? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not. I was the cop assigned to your wife's death. I believed you, I thought you deserved the chance for revenge. I helped you find the other guy who was in your bathroom that night. The guy who cracked your skull and fucked your wife. We found him and you killed him. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO - Green Revisions 10-4-99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't remember, so I helped you start looking again, looking for the guy you already killed. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who are you saying he was? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just some guy. Does it even matter who? I stopped asking myself why a long time ago. No reason, no conspiracy; just bad fucking luck. A couple of junkies, too strung out to realize that your wife didn't live alone. When you killed him, I've never seen you so happy - I was convinced you'd remember. But it didn't stick, like nothing ever sticks. Like this won't stick. Leonard looks at the Polaroid of himself. TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the picture, right? I took that, right when you did it. Look how happy you are. Before you forgot. I wanted to see that face again. LEONARD (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you; I gave you a reason to live and you were more than happy to help. You lie to yourself! You don't want the truth, the truth is a fucking coward. So you make up your own truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO - Green Revisions 10-4-99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at your police file. It was complete when I gave it to you. Who took the 12 pages out? LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You probably. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You took them out. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I do that? TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To set yourself a puzzle you won't ever solve. You know how many towns, how many guys called James G? Or John G? Shit, Leonard, I'm a John G. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name's Teddy. TEDDY (chuckles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother calls me Teddy. I'm John Edward Gammell. Cheer up, there's a lot of John G's for us to find. All you do is moan. I'm the one that has to live with what you've done. I'm the one that has to put it all together. You just wander around playing detective. You're living a dream, kid. A dead wife to pine for and a sense of purpose to your life. A romantic quest which you wouldn't end even if I wasn't in the picture. Leonard sticks the gun in Teddy's face. LEONARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should kill you. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit it! (brushes the gun away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a killer, Lenny. That's why you're so good at it. Leonard SEARCHES Teddy's pockets, still holding the gun o Teddy. Leonard finds Teddy's CAR KEYS. He gets off Teddy moves towards the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMENTO - Green Revisions 10-4-99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, where are you going? You know what time it is? Leonard stares at Teddy, mystified. Teddy grins. TEDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
